result.execSummary:
The defendant Marston R Croff-Goodrich was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Dangerous Weapon-Person < 18, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.60(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: On Count #1, the Court sentences Mr. Croff-Goodrich to pay a fine of $250 plus costs, plus $200 DNA surcharge= $768 plus court-appointed attorney fees,  to be paid in $240 per month installments commencing on 2/9/17 and on the last day of each month thereafter until paid in full; non-payment shall result in a 20 day jail term with Huber privileges, consecutive

***PER 1-19-17 ORDER -Order for payment of Atty. Montiho as appointed defense counsel in the amount of $42.02.***

***PER 3-1-17 ORDER -Order for payment of Atty. Corey Montiho as appointed defense counsel in the amount of  $230.95  ***
The Court orders Mr. Croff-Goodrich to comply with DNA sample provision.

Criminal Case Settlement

[MK] case called at 2:16pm. 
Defendant Marston R Croff-Goodrich in court with Attorney Corey Montiho.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " Guilty " entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #2.

On Count #1, the Court sentences Mr. Croff-Goodrich to pay a fine of $250 plus costs, plus $200 DNA surcharge= $768 plus court-appointed attorney fees,  to be paid in $240 per month installments commencing on 2/9/17 and on the last day of each month thereafter until paid in full; non-payment shall result in a 20 day jail term with Huber privileges, consecutive
The Court orders Mr. Croff-Goodrich to comply with DNA sample provision.  
recess 2:28pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on January 9, 2017 at 02:00 pm.

Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for Branch IV:
[MK} case called briefly at 9:09am and then at 9:34am.
Defendant Marston R Croff-Goodrich and Attorney Corey Montiho are not in court.  ADA Theresa A Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Both court staff and the DA's Office staff have received messages that Mr. Montiho cannot appear today due to illness.  
The Defendant has also telephoned in to say that Attorney Montiho's office had indicated that there was not a need to appear, however court staff informed the Defendant that this is not correct.  However the Defendant was then given a new date and time of December 22nd at 1:30pm  
The Court directs that Bail stands as fixed in the interim.
recess 9:35am.
